com.temp.cam.camerasdk.view.holocolorpicker

Class ColorPicker

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • com.temp.cam.camerasdk.view.holocolorpicker.ColorPicker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback

    public class ColorPicker
extends android.view.View
    Displays a holo-themed color picker.

    Use getColor() to retrieve the selected color.
    Use addSVBar(SVBar) to add a Saturation/Value Bar.
    Use addOpacityBar(OpacityBar) to add a Opacity Bar.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  ColorPicker.OnColorChangedListener
      An interface that is called whenever the color is changed.
      static interface  ColorPicker.OnColorSelectedListener
      An interface that is called whenever a new color has been selected.

        private android.graphics.RectF mColorWheelRectangle
        The rectangle enclosing the color wheel.

      • mCenterRectangle

        private android.graphics.RectF mCenterRectangle
        The rectangle enclosing the center inside the color wheel.

      • mUserIsMovingPointer

        private boolean mUserIsMovingPointer
        true if the user clicked on the pointer to start the move mode.
        false once the user stops touching the screen.
        See Also:
        onTouchEvent(android.view.MotionEvent)

      • mColor

        private int mColor
        The ARGB value of the currently selected color.

      • mCenterOldColor

        private int mCenterOldColor
        The ARGB value of the center with the old selected color.

      • mShowCenterOldColor

        private boolean mShowCenterOldColor
        Whether to show the old color in the center or not.

      • mCenterNewColor

        private int mCenterNewColor
        The ARGB value of the center with the new selected color.

      • mTranslationOffset

        private float mTranslationOffset
        Number of pixels the origin of this view is moved in X- and Y-direction.

        We use the center of this (quadratic) View as origin of our internal coordinate system. Android uses the upper left corner as origin for the View-specific coordinate system. So this is the value we use to translate from one coordinate system to the other.

        Note: (Re)calculated in onMeasure(int, int).

        See Also:
        onDraw(android.graphics.Canvas)

      • mSlopX

        private float mSlopX
        Distance between pointer and user touch in X-direction.

      • mSlopY

        private float mSlopY
        Distance between pointer and user touch in Y-direction.

      • mAngle

        private float mAngle
        The pointer's position expressed as angle (in rad).

        Paint instance used to draw the center with the new selected color.

      • calculateColor

        private int calculateColor(float angle)
        Calculate the color using the supplied angle.
        Parameters:
        angle - The selected color's position expressed as angle (in rad).
        Returns:
        The ARGB value of the color on the color wheel at the specified angle.

      • getColor

        public int getColor()
        Get the currently selected color.
        Returns:
        The ARGB value of the currently selected color.

      • setColor

        public void setColor(int color)
        Set the color to be highlighted by the pointer. If the instances SVBar and the OpacityBar aren't null the color will also be set to them
        Parameters:
        color - The RGB value of the color to highlight. If this is not a color displayed on the color wheel a very simple algorithm is used to map it to the color wheel. The resulting color often won't look close to the original color. This is especially true for shades of grey. You have been warned!

      • colorToAngle

        private float colorToAngle(int color)
        Convert a color to an angle.
        Parameters:
        color - The RGB value of the color to "find" on the color wheel.
        Returns:
        The angle (in rad) the "normalized" color is displayed on the color wheel.
